alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 4:52AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 630 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms has diminished in the area. However, due to the earlier heavy rain around Iron Mountain minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Reference Point Creek, Truxton Wash, Salt Creek, Surprise Canyon, Fox Canyon Wash, Lost Creek, Spencer Canyon, Iron Spring Wash, Grapevine Wash, Colorado River and Hualapai Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Canyon Ranch, Grand Canyon Skywalk and Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
